side_effects.name: Unspecified disorder of skin and subcutaneous tissue

contraindications.reason: Risk of GI bleeding and perforation

demographic_risks.recommendations: Use lowest effective dose for shortest duration. Consider PPI co-therapy.
Avoid if possible. If necessary use lowest dose with PPI.
Do not use with chickenpox or flu. Weight-based dosing required.
Use with extreme caution. Consider alternatives.
Avoid if possible. If necessary monitor closely.
Take ibuprofen 30min after or 8hr before aspirin.
Use lowest dose for shortest time. Consider alternatives.
Monitor BP. May need antihypertensive adjustment.

drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. If necessary monitor INR closely and watch for bleeding.

drug_interactions.mechanism: Additive GI toxicity + reduced aspirin cardioprotection
drug_interactions.clinical_effect: GI bleeding and reduced MI protection
drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. If needed take aspirin first.
Take aspirin 30min before or 8hr after ibuprofen.
Avoid if possible. Consider PPI if necessary.
Monitor lithium levels. May need 25-50% dose reduction.
Avoid with high-dose MTX. Monitor closely with low-dose.
Monitor fluid status and renal function.
Avoid if possible. Monitor renal function closely.
Avoid if possible. Monitor renal function closely.
Caution in patients with seizure history.
Take bisphosphonate first. Consider alternative analgesic.
Avoid concurrent use especially chronic alcohol use.
